comments.body: Do we really want to terminate the page walking when the name doesn't match? I don't know the interface but instinctively I'd append through the whole page if it matches and return true if len > 0.

We discussed about this offline, but also mentioning here for posterity.

Route53 API takes the starting name and returns a list of records sorted on name starting from that name. Since we need exact matches on the given name and the returned list is sorted, we can terminate the walk when we reach a name that doesn't match. 

It is described here - https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sdk-for-go/api/service/route53/#Route53.ListResourceRecordSets

fwiw, it was a bit odd for me at first to see that Add is defined on value receiver and not pointer receiver. It will work since the struct has only one field which is a pointer.
So I will leave it upto you (fine if you want to leave it as is) but I think its still better to make this pointer receiver.
https://golang.org/doc/faq#methods_on_values_or_pointers has the guidelines.
(If you decide to change this to pointer receiver, you should update all the methods on this struct)

Agreed in principle.  My only defence is that ResourceRecordSets is a stateless interface of methods.  But I guess it is mildly confusing.  I'll address in a separate PR, as this again has knock-on effects on other libraries.
Will be great if you can add TODOs for things you plan to do in later PRs.
No, it's more a note to future developers who come after me, who might want to extract error codes.  Can delete the comment if you really prefer.
